003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

006 * Copyright (c) 2006-2022 Wilhelm Burger, Mark J. Burge. All rights reserved.
007 * Visit https://imagingbook.com for additional details.
008 ******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.common.hough;
010
011import java.util.Locale;
012
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.AlgebraicLine;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.line.HessianLine;
016
017/**
018 * <p>
019 * This class represents a straight line of the form (x - xRef) * cos(angle) +
020 * (y - yRef) * sin(angle) = radius. It is used by the Hough transform (see
021 * {@link imagingbook.common.hough.HoughTransformLines}). It inherits from
022 * {@link HessianLine} which is, in turn, a subclass of {@link AlgebraicLine}.
023 * It adds an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and a counter (count) for
024 * pixel votes. Instances are immutable. See Sec. 12.2 of [1] for additional
025 * details.
026 * </p>
027 * <p>
028 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
029 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
030 * </p>
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 * @version 2022/08/24
034 */
035public class HoughLine extends HessianLine implements Comparable<HoughLine> {
036        
037        private final double xRef, yRef;        // reference point
038        private final int count;                        // pixel votes for this line
039        
040        // static factory methods -------------------------------
041        
042        public static HoughLine from(Pnt2d p1, Pnt2d p2, Pnt2d pRef, int count) {
043                return new HoughLine(AlgebraicLine.from(p1, p2), pRef.getX(), pRef.getY(), count);
044        }
045        
046        // constructors -----------------------------------------
047
048        /**
049         * Constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from the
050         * specified {@link HessianLine} parameters (angle, radius),
051         * an arbitrary reference point (xRef, yRef) and count.
052         * 
053         * @param angle the line's normal angle (see {@link HessianLine})
054         * @param radius the line's radius (distance to reference point)
055         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
056         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
057         * @param count pixel votes for this line
058         */
059        public HoughLine(double angle, double radius, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
060                super(angle, radius);
061                this.xRef = xRef;
062                this.yRef = yRef;
063                this.count = count;
064        }
065        
066        /**
067         * Constructor. 
068         * Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
069         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance.
070         * The line parameters are adjusted to the specified reference point
071         * (actually only parameter c is modified, since a change of reference point
072         * effects only a shift of the line).
073         * The two lines are equivalent, i.e., contain the same points (x,y).
074         * Thus the distance from a given point (x,y) is the same from the original
075         * line and the new line.
076         * @param line an existing line ({@link AlgebraicLine} or subclass)
077         * @param xRef reference point x-coordinate
078         * @param yRef reference point y-coordinate
079         * @param count pixel votes for this line
080         */
081        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line, double xRef, double yRef, int count) {
082                super(new AlgebraicLine(line.A, line.B, line.C + line.A * (xRef - line.getXref()) + line.B * (yRef - line.getYref())));
083                this.xRef = xRef;
084                this.yRef = yRef;
085                this.count = count;
086        }
087        
088        /**
089         * Convenience constructor. Creates a new {@link HoughLine} instance from a given
090         * {@link AlgebraicLine} (or any subclass) instance with the same reference point 
091         * as the original line and zero count.
092         * 
093         * @param line a {@link AlgebraicLine} instance
094         */
095        public HoughLine(AlgebraicLine line) {
096                this(line, line.getXref(), line.getYref(), 0);
097        }
098        
099        // ------------------------------------------
100        
101        @Override
102        public double getXref() {
103                return xRef;
104        }
105        
106        @Override
107        public double getYref() {
108                return yRef;
109        }
110        
111        public int getCount() {
112                return count;
113        }
114        
115        // other methods ------------------------------------------
116        
117        /**
118         * Required by the {@link Comparable} interface, used for sorting lines by their
119         * point count (in descending order, i.e., strong lines come first).
120         * @param other another {@link HoughLine} instance.
121         */
122        @Override
123        public int compareTo(HoughLine other) {
124                return Integer.compare(other.count, this.count);
125        }
126        
127        @Override
128        public String toString() {
129                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s <angle = %.3f, radius = %.3f, xRef = %.3f, yRef = %.3f, count = %d>",
130                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), getAngle(), getRadius(), getXref(), getYref(), count);
131        }
132        
133}
